alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:48PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rio Blanco County through 515 PM MDT... At 447 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rangely, or 46 miles southeast of Vernal, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rangely. This includes the following highways... Colorado 64 between mile markers 10 and 28. Colorado 139 between mile markers 65 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
